holy_days.name: Passover
holy_days.notes: Passover commemorates God's deliverance of Israel from Egypt and points to Jesus Christ as our Passover Lamb, whose sacrifice brings freedom from sin.

holy_days.name: The First Day of Unleavened Bread
holy_days.notes: This day begins the Feast of Unleavened Bread, symbolizing the putting away of sin and the call to live a sincere and truthful life before God.

holy_days.name: The Wavesheaf Offering
holy_days.notes: The Wavesheaf Offering represents Christ’s resurrection and acceptance by the Father as the firstfruits of those who will be raised to eternal life.

holy_days.name: The Last Day of Unleavened Bread
holy_days.notes: This day commemorates Israel’s final break from Egypt and reminds believers of the complete deliverance God provides from sin and bondage.

holy_days.name: Pentecost
holy_days.notes: Pentecost marks the giving of the Holy Spirit and the founding of the New Testament Church, empowering believers to live God’s way of life.

holy_days.name: The Feast of Trumpets
holy_days.notes: This day pictures the return of Jesus Christ, the resurrection of the saints, and the establishment of God’s Kingdom on earth.

holy_days.name: The Day of Atonement
holy_days.notes: The Day of Atonement represents reconciliation between God and humanity, and the removal of Satan’s influence from the world.

holy_days.name: The First Day of the Feast of Tabernacles
holy_days.notes: The Feast of Tabernacles pictures the Millennial reign of Christ, a time of peace, abundance, and restoration for all nations.

holy_days.name: The Last Great Day
holy_days.notes: The Last Great Day points to God’s plan for final judgment and the opportunity for salvation for all who were never truly called.
